titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Lesbian Love Records LSC.2207
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Stacy Wood, 2013; Sabrina Ponce, 2018; and Morgan Taylor, 2019.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2022 October 7.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-10-07 14:11:03 -0700.

did.abstract: B. Love was a radio personality who hosted shows on the listener-sponsored radio station KPFK, based out of North Hollywood, California. The content of the programs was based on lesbian lives and ranged from issues of spirituality to call-in shows and interviews. This collection consists of 36 audio reels containing interviews, poetry, outtakes, and other audio recordings from her radio program "Lesbian Love."
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: This collection contains processed audiovisual materials. All requests to access digital materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lesbian Love records (Collection 2207). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

Processed by Stacy Wood, 2013. Description enhanced and further physical processing completed by Sabrina Ponce in 2018. Audiotapes were reformatted by UCLA Library AV Preservation and described by Morgan Taylor in 2019.

odd.head: UCLA Catalog Record ID
odd.p: We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

odd.head: Sponsor
odd.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: B. Love was a radio personality who hosted shows on the listener-sponsored radio station KPFK, based out of North Hollywood, California. The content was based on lesbian lives and ranged from issues of spirituality to call-in shows and interviews. Lesbian Love was one of these shows.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 36 audio reels containing interviews, poetry, outtakes, and other audio recordings from the radio program Lesbian Love, broadcast on KPFK.

controlaccess.subject: Radio programs for gays -- California -- Los Angeles.
Lesbian Love (Radio program) -- Archives.
